dataset.title: Michigan Department of Environmental Quality (MI): water quality sampling program, 1967-1997

abstract.para: This program is the water quality sampling program for the state of Michigan (formerly the Department of Natural Resources, then the Department of Environmental Quality). Most, if not all lakes are public and > 25 acres. The goal of the program is to determine inland lake trophic status. Spring samples are taken to determine total phosphorus and other parameter levels of the lake while it is well mixed. Summer samples were also performed for other parameters.

contact.organizationName: Fisheries and Wildlife, Michigan State University

section.title: Chemical Analyses
section.para: Chemical analyses performed by the MI DNR-Environmental Laboratory
Turbidity - NA
color – P310001WI; Standard Methods; 14th edition, 1975
specific_conductance – P340001WF; flow-through specific conductance electrode; Standard Methods. 1975
specific_conductance_field
oxygen_dissolved – dissolved oxygen using a probe unless value is between 0 and 1.5 mg/L, at which point Winkler titration is recommended
ph- measured using a pH meter with glass pH electrode; Standard Methods. 1975
alkalinity_total – E 820000WF; Colorimetric, automated methyl orange, AAII. (EPA 1979; Methods for chemical analyses of water and wastes)
nitrogen_organic_total - NA
nitrogen_ammonia_total – EPA E430000WF; Colorimetric, automated Phenolate, AAII (EPA 1979: Methods for chemical analyses of water and wastes)
nitrogen_kjeldahl_total – EPA E 450001WF; Colorimetric, block digestor, automated salicylate (EPA 1979: Methods for chemical analyses of water and wastes)
nitrite_plus_nitrate – EPA Method E400000WF (EPA 1979; Methods for chemical analyses of water and wastes). Colorimetric, automated cadmium reduction AAII.
phosphorus_total - EPA Method E550001WF; Methods for chemical analysis of water and wastes (EPA 1974). Colorimetric, Block Digestor, Mercury, Automated Ascorbic Acid Reduction;. Storet number 00665
carbon_total_organic - NA
calcium_dissolved – Atomic Absorption – Direct Aspiration
calcium_total - – Atomic Absorption – Direct Aspiration
chloride_total – E720000WF; Colorimetric, Automated Ferricyanide AAII; (EPA 1979; Methods for chemical analyses of water and wastes)
sulfate_total – EPA E 790010WF; Colorimetric, automated methelthymol blue method. (EPA 1979: Methods for chemical analyses of water and wastes)
sulfate_dissolved - EPA E 790010WF; Colorimetric, automated methelthymol blue method. (EPA 1979: Methods for chemical analyses of water and wastes)
silicate_unfiltered_reactive – E 760000WF; Colorimetric, Automated Molybdosilicate, AAII. (EPA 1979; Methods for chemical analyses of water and wastes)
chlorophyll_a –Method P210001WF; (Standard Methods for the Examination of water and wastewater); extracted using acetone

phosphorus_total_orthophosphate – EPA Method E550001WF; Methods for chemical analysis of water and wastes (EPA 1974). Colorimetric, Block Digestor, Mercury, Automated Ascorbic Acid Reduction;. Storet number 00665
Detection Limits
nitrite_plus_nitrate – 0.0059 mg/L
phosphorus_total –
[BEFORE 1983] – Detection limit of 0.0052 mg/L
[FOR 1983-1997] - Detection limit of 0.0019 mg/L
phosphorus_total_orthophosphate –Detection limit of 0.003 mg/L
nitrogen_kjeldahl_total – Detection limit of 0.064 mg/L
nitrogen_ammonia_total –Detection limit of 0.0071 mg/l
chlorophyll_a – Detection limit .2 ug/L
specific_conductance – Detection limit of 10 umho/cm
alkalinity_total – Detection limit of 2.63 mg/L
chloride_total – Detection limit of 0.28 mg/L
calcium_dissolved – 1.0 mg/L
calcium_total - – 1.0 mg/L
silicate_unfiltered_reactive – Detection limit of 0.019 mg/L
sulfate_total – Detection limit of 0.82 mg/L
color – Detection limit of 3 Pt-Co units
Remark Codes:
A = Value reported is the mean of two or more determinations
C = Calculated. Value stored was not measured directly- but was calculated from other data available
D = Field measurement. Some parameter codes (e.g. 401 "Field pH") imply this condition without this remark
J = Estimated. Value shown is not a result of analytical measurement
K = Off-scale low. Actual value not known- but known to be less than value shown
L = Off-scale high. Actual value not known- but known to be greater than value shown
Q = Sample held beyond normal holding time
T = Value reported is less than the criteria of detection
W = Value observed is less than the lowest value reportable under remark "T"

samplingDescription.para: Most, if not all lakes are public and > 25 acres. For some lakes, sampling twice per year for each lake, once in spring during spring overturn (usually April) and once in late summer (August or September) when lakes are typically thermally stratified. But in the early years, often only spring or only late summer/fall. Spring surveys were conducted during spring overturn, which generally in Michigan occurs within a week after ice out. Time of ice out depended on geographic location and climate, but generally occurred sometime in April or early May. Summer lake surveys were conducted during maximum stratification, which generally occurred during late August or early September in the Upper Peninsula, and during September in the lower peninsula. Lakes deeper than 25 feet generally begin to stratify after spring overturn and continue until late September or early October. Lakes less than 25 feet deep may not stratify or only stratify periodically for short intervals. Lakes were sampled at the deep basin. If the lake is divided into 2 or more basins that have little exchange of water, then each basin was sampled. The deep basin was found using a bathymetric map or a sounding line. If the lake was not mapped, then the deep area was located by making 4-5 transects across the lake. At a minimum, lake surveys included the following parameters: DO, temperature, pH, alkalinity, conductivity, chloride, chlorophyll a, Secchi depth. Secchi readings were taken between 10am-4pm. All water was collected with a Kemmerer sampler except for chlorophyll which was collected using an integrated sampler (a weighted bucket with two tubes through the cover) through the euphotic zone (determined to be two times the Secchi depth reading). Samples are taken from the surface, mid-depth (thermocline, if one exists), and within 3 ft of the bottom sediments.

attribute.attributeDefinition: distance from the water surface the sample was taken

codeDefinition.definition: Samples are not collected continuously or as a grab. STORET used this code for replicate samples.

Samples collected as a grab. The number comprising the sample may or may not be reported. If the number comprising the sample is reported the number will be stored in the Composite Grab Number column of the Sample table.
